conclusion: The principle of a certain negative ion air purification is shown in the figure. A mixed airflow consisting of air and negatively charged dust particles enters a collector composed of a pair of parallel metal plates.

In the collector, the velocity v₀ of the air and charged particles along the direction of the plates remains constant. Under the action of a uniform electric field, the charged particles hit the metal plates and are collected.
It is known that the length of the metal plates is L and the spacing between the plates is d. The effects of gravity and inter-particle interactions are negligible.
If air resistance is neglected, and all particles with mass m and charge -α are just completely collected, determine the voltage U₁ between the two metal plates.

premise: A uniform electric field E = U₁/d exists between the plates.
The electric force on a particle is F = qE = -αE; its magnitude gives a constant vertical acceleration a = αE/m directed toward the collector plate.
The flight time inside the plates is t = L/v₀ (horizontal motion is unaffected).
With zero initial vertical velocity, the vertical displacement in this time is s = ½ a t².
Requiring s to equal the full plate spacing d yields d = ½(αE/m)(L/v₀)².
Insert E = U₁/d and solve for U₁, giving the expression above.
